intro: Psacalium brachycomum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved psacalium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Psacalium brachycomum is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
